content.rendered:
University of Saskatchewan Admission is ongoing for all interested candidates who wish to apply for admission.

University of Saskatchewan Admission Requirements is outline below;

The English Language Proficiency Test Requirements:

Test maximum Score necessary
IELTS (Academic)
International English Language Testing System
  • in general Band  grade Score of: 6.5
    With minimum individual scores of

    • Reading: 6
    • Listening: 6
    • Speaking: 6
    • Writing: 6
TOEFL iBT
Test of English as a Foreign LanguageIncludes the TOEFL iBT Special Home EditionInstitution code – 0980
  • Internet Based: 86
    With maximum individual grade scores of

    • Reading: 19
    • Listening: 19
    • Speaking: 19
    • Writing: 19
CanTEST
Canadian Test of English for Scholars and Trainees
  • 4.5
    With least amount individual scores of

    • Reading: 4.5
    • Listening: 4.5
    • Speaking: 4
    • Writing: 4
CAEL
Canadian Academic English Language Assessment
  • 70
    With maximum of  individual scores grade of

    • Reading: 60
    • Listening: 60
    • Speaking: 60
    • Writing: 60
MELAB
Michigan English Language Assessment Battery
  • 85
    With bare minimum in individual grade scores of

    • Reading: 80
    • Listening: 80
    • Speaking: >=3
    • Writing: 80
PTE Academic
Pearson Test of English Academic
  • in general score of 63
    With a maximum individual skills with grade scores of  the following

    • Reading: 59
    • Listening: 59
    • Speaking: 59
    • Writing: 59
Cambridge English: Advanced (CAE)
  •  Minimum of C with 65 grade score
Duolingo English Test (DET)
Test results are  valid for two years from test date
  • Score of 110 or improved
Accepted for undergraduate direct-entry programs only for admission to the 2024-22 academic years.

 

Before applying Applicants must complete one of the following qualification outlined below before being considered for admission:

TEST Required score
Advanced Placement (AP) English 4 or better
International Baccalaureate (IB) English A1 or A2 Higher Level 5 or better
International Baccalaureate (IB) English B Higher Level 5 or better
GCSE/IGCSE/GCE O-Level English, English Language, or English as a Second Language B or better
Level English or English Language GCE A/AS/AICE
